text: Edward Emerson Barnard (December 16, 1857 â€“ February 6, 1923) was an American astronomer. He found Amalthea, a moon of the planet Jupiter. Barnard's star and Barnard's galaxy were named after him. Barnard made a list of dark nebulae, the Barnard Catalogue of Dark Markings in the Sky, or the Barnard Catalogue for short. The nebulae listed by Barnard have become known as 'Barnard objects'.. == References == ==Other websites== Category:1857 births Category:1923 deaths Category:American astronomers Category:Scientists from Nashville, Tennessee
title: Edward Emerson Barnard
